newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy evacuates 80 foreigners from Congo.
newsitem.headline: Italy evacuates 80 foreigners from Congo.

text.p: Italy said it had evacuated 80 foreigners from Congo's capital Brazzaville on Thursday on a military transport plane that took in Italian paratroopers to guard their country's embassy.
A Foreign Ministry statement said the operation, conducted in coordination with French forces on the ground, had flown out 50 Italians and 30 people of other nationalities.
The C-130 Hercules plane took on board a further 25 Italians and several other foreigners who had been evacuated from Congo during a stop-over in Gabon on its way to Rome, the statement said.
"Despite the risks arising from the tense situation on the ground, the entire Brazzaville operation was carried out without particular difficulty," it added.
Forces loyal to Congolese President Pascal Lissouba have been battling the Cobra militia of former Marxist military ruler Denis Sassou Nguesso.
Fighting continued to spread throughout Brazzaville on Thursday, ending a day-old ceasefire negotiated after a week of fierce clashes.
